posts.name: philip youngblood FRC 7121
posts.cooked:
Dallas/Ft. Worth area teams… Are you using GitHub?  Our district has it blocked, and we are being told that no teams in the area are using it.  I find that hard to believe (and puzzled how they would know that)…

Please let me know if you are, and/or have a good programming alternative or work around.

Thanks!
Have you tried GitLab? You can use a similar Git-based version management system. Although having GitHub blocked seems really odd.

posts.name: Adam Fleming
posts.cooked: Not DFW, but our school in the Milwaukee, WI area also blocks it on the public wifi and the one our students connect their Chromebooks to. The reasoning is kids have downloaded programs or programs that access GitHub to get around network blocks and such.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor

posts.name: Gabriel Krotkov (he/him)
posts.cooked: Team 6672 in DFW definitely uses GitHub, you can find it here . (Cistercian, if you want a school name to tell your administrators.)

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked:
In Plano ISD, GitHub was blocked for a while. When we contacted the district, they said their is nothing much they could do due to GitHub policies didn’t align with PISD. But, the district did provide a T-Mobile hotspot that we could connect to whenever we need to use GitHub. But now, GitHub is unblocked. How and why? That I’m not sure as I learned recently it was unblocked.

philipyoungblood:

being told that no teams in the area are using it

That is definitely not true. But you can also mention so many FRC teams use GitHub, and you can mention so many vendors codes rely on GitHub.

posts.name: Drew Williams
posts.cooked: We don’t have github itself blocked, but downloading over ssh is blocked as well as some of the vendor library links for us which is annoying. So we just use a hotspot to build and setup the deps once, then we can code and commit on school wifi. Then, at the end of the day we reconnect to our hotspots and push to github.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: I moved to California just for districts

posts.custom_user_title: I moved to California just for districts

posts.cooked: GitHub is blocked on school devices and the internet. However, that does not mean you cannot use GitHub on your personal devices. That’s what we (Knights Robotics 6901) do. You can not use GitHub at school but bypass it by bringing your personal laptop to school and using a VPN. I do not do that, but it is an option.

posts.name: Kade Rabe
posts.cooked:
philipyoungblood:

no teams in the area are using it

yeah they are pretty clearly just lying to you guys, i would say the great majority of teams likely use github.

posts.name: Stuart Rampy
posts.cooked: We(1745/8874) use Github in RichardsonISD.  We did have to go through several hoops to unblock specific repos and pages.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: You can git clone with HTTPS urls instead of SSH if needed
